availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John J. Brosee (Mason County, Kentucky, clerk and councilman)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, clerk and councilman. Kentucky native. Son of John Brosee and Fredericka Bartruff Brosee. Clerk in Mason County in 1860. Boat clerk in Mason County in 1863. Member of the Maysville Board of Council in Mason County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 330.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, Ward 4, p. 435A-B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Mason County, KY, October 1863, p. 28.
"Died This Morning," Evening Bulletin, (Maysville, KY), Feb. 27, 1900.
KYR-0001-004-0465.
